result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas R Johnson

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM Defendant Nicholas R Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Eryn M Menden appeared by video for Nicholas R Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status.
Defendant is working on getting into treatment.
Defendant may appear at the next hearing by zoom.
Hearing scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.

10:51 AM Defendant Nicholas R Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Nicholas R Johnson.  Attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz in court for State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

4:17 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Nicholas R Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Nicholas R Johnson. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
